issue.title: [question] Why are there several numbered versions?

content.raw:
`ignition-math4`, `ignition-math3` etc are different major versions. The major version is increased when there is an API change that breaks ABI. The major version is added to the name to allow multiple major versions to be installed at the same time. If you're creating a project using ignition math all of your code should use the same major version, but you don't need to install the other versions too.

I don't know what `ignition-math` on its own is. It might have been before ignition math reached version 1.0. 

I think questions about ignition libraries could be asked on http://answers.gazebosim.org/questions/ . More people are watching there than the issue tracker here so you'll usually get answers faster there.
